title: Design thinking - Wikipedia
text: Design thinking refers to the set of cognitive, strategic and practical procedures used by designers in the process of designing, and to the body of knowledge that has been developed about how people reason when engaging with design problems. Design thinking is also associated with prescriptions for the innovation of products and services within business and social contexts.

title: What is Design Thinking?
text: Design thinking is a human-centered approach to innovation that draws from the designer's toolkit to integrate the needs of people, the possibilities of technology, and the requirements for business success. It's a way of thinking and working as well as a collection of hands-on methods.

title: Design Thinking - The Interaction Design Foundation
text: Design thinking is a non-linear, iterative process that teams use to understand users, challenge assumptions, redefine problems and create innovative solutions to prototype and test. It involves five phases: Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype, and Test.
